translation: If Thou, O Lord, thinkest it possible for me to see it, do Thou, then, O Lord of the Yogis, show me Thy imperishable Self.
commentary: 11.4 Manyse Thou thinkest? If if? That that? possible possible? Maya by me? to see to see? It is thus? Lord O Lord? Yogeshwar O Lord of Yogins? Then then? Me me? You Thou? Show show? Atmanam (Thy) Self? infinitive imperishable.Commentary Arjuna is very keen and eager to see the Cosmic Form of the Lord. He prays to Him to grant him the vision. This supreme vision can be obtained only through His grace.Yogesvara
